page.title: 09THEALE GREEN SCHOOL
page.content: In 1962 Ken Shield was appointed to set up a Grammar School at Theale. After 22 years as Headmaster he retired in 1985. He had appointed all the members of staff and the ethos of the school was his. There is a strong emphasis on the pastoral system and there has been an attempt to continue in the comprehensive the family life and atmosphere which had been built up in the Grammar School. The eagle in the school crest refers to both the Roman presence and a passage in Isaiah which refers to a soaring eagle. The aim of the school has been to show the pupils the importance of the past and that they, if working properly and with the right support, can soar to the heights.
